Description: Mould-made shabti in glazed composition; depicted mummiform and standing with a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a modelled face and crossed arms in relief holding two hoes in relief; black painted details; dark, thick green glaze; broken below knees; glaze damaged and worn.
Curator's comments: Shabtis are chiefly associated in funerary context though it happens that they are found in settlement or sanctuary contexts (in Kom Firin: Spencer 2014, 178, pl. 547-549; in Karnak temple: Masson forthcoming; see also Webb 2014 for shabtis discovered in various contexts from the Mediterranean world). On shabtis, see for example: Aubert 1974; Aubert 2005. This shabti could have been locally produced at the Scarab Factory. Aubert, J.-F. and Aubert, L. 1974, Statuettes égyptiennes. Chaouabtis, ouchebtis, Paris, 1974. Aubert, J.-F. and Aubert, L. 2005, Statuettes funéraires égyptiennes du département des Monnaies, Médailles et Antiques, Paris. Masson, A. forthcoming, Le quartier des prêtres sur la rive est du Lac Sacré à Karnak. Spencer, N. 2014, Kom Firin II: the urban fabric and landscape (Research publication British Museum 192), London. Webb, V. forthcoming (in 2014), Faience Material from the Samos Heraion Excavations, Samos XIII, Bonn.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OL.3)
Condition: incomplete - lower leg section missing, surface worn
